page.title: 13Housing in Aith
page.content: In our block there are 75 houses including two housing schemes. The first housing scheme (Whitelaw) was built 31 years ago. The second scheme (Wirliegart) was built 6 years ago.In Whitelaw there are 10 houses.In Whirliegart there are 19 houses. 8 of these houses are for old people and there is a warden who looks after them. Both these housing schemes belong to the Shetland Islands Council. 4 new houses are being built at the moment. The number of houses on crofts is 24. 15 of these are of the traditional stone-built type which are small with thick walls and roofs of wood covered in felt or, in a few cases, modernised with tiles. There are 57 houses burning peat as fuel.
